token-efficient.name: Token Efficient
token-efficient.description: Optimized for minimal token usage while maintaining quality

comprehensive.name: Comprehensive
comprehensive.description: Detailed prompts for complex tasks requiring thorough analysis

agent-specific.name: Agent Specific
agent-specific.description: Optimized prompts for specific agent modes

context-aware.name: Context Aware
context-aware.description: Prompts that adapt based on available context and constraints

practices: Include success criteria and validation rules
Define test cases and edge cases
Include rollback and error handling requirements

antiPatterns.name: Vague Instructions
antiPatterns.description: Too general or ambiguous task descriptions
examples: Good: "Implement user authentication with JWT tokens"

antiPatterns.name: Missing Context
antiPatterns.description: Lack of necessary project or technical context
examples: Good: "Build a REST API for user management using Node.js and PostgreSQL"

antiPatterns.name: Overly Complex
antiPatterns.description: Too much detail or complexity for the task
examples: Bad: 1000+ token prompt for simple task
Good: 200-300 token prompt with essential details

antiPatterns.name: Inconsistent Format
examples: Bad: Unstructured text without clear sections
Good: Structured with clear headings and sections
